bQSDKL70Twuov6K8q2oA1g.text: Lively, Energetic vibe, a wonderful place to have breakfast with friends. Usually its pretty crowded, especially on the weekends so give yourself some time to be seated. It can get pretty loud from everyone's  conversations, but it's a fun atmosphere. My favorite is the make your own omelette, which comes with up to three toppings. Great staff as well.

hIS1zZHfuxkR_Pjg9w1o6g.text: OMG the Ultimate was super fantastic! Texas toast flavored with toffee, caramel, pecan AND powdered sugar! Yes, please! And, yes, this was our group dessert choice after our meals of Glen's buffalo chicken wrap & Bueno Beni (eggs Benedict). Everything was delicious and exquisitely gratifying! Definitely coming back for another round at their extensive menu choices!

hDvD31jAjo0NpUk2ofvS1w.text: This is my absolute mostest favoritest place to go for breakfast! It's perfect! My parents love this place. My kids always choose OSC! During peak times it can be a bit of a wait, but it's so worth it. The staff are some of the nicest people. It's almost like Cheers, they always remember my face and my family. The food is delicious. I'm a huge fan of the Ultimate French Toast. My son also orders that and makes it a platter. The Banana Creme Pie pancakes are also incredible!! I know they have other things on the menu, but I always order breakfast and I'm never disappointed. Thank you, OSC, for always taking great care of me and my family and friends!

fp5YZyyU6g1n4mzytvFsJg.text: Wow this place is hands down the best breakfast spot I've ever been to! Best hash browns I have ever had! Tiffany gave amazing service she was very attentive and had no problems recommending amazing food I got the fiesta Benedict and holy smokes was it amazing my sister got the classic breakfast and there was nothing classic about it! They have 5 star food with a hometown feel I loved every bit and the coffee is so strong and delicious

skyfLC2DU0MdJZPRkxGsHg.text: My In-laws are new to the area and we go to breakfast weekly.  We have used Yelp to find new places to try and came across this gem!!! We have now been to Sunrise 4 times!!! The staff is very welcoming and the food is amazing!! We have not tried one meal we didn't like- wraps, French toast, and regular breakfast.

tQSTKU6mpf1eh6kBPfpWRQ.text: The Owner and servers are super friendly!!! And the food!! GREAT. MUST stop at while in Vegas. Dump the generic IHOP and chain locations. Stop here.  The Champ approved!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

g81zU1Ms2nc_9YVuRQutbw.text: Upon my first visit to this absolutely fabulous place one of the persons in our party was wheelchair bound.  We were greeted with kindness and assistance.  Seated in a very comfortable and most importantly accessible spot.  Now to the food.  Alex, our server answered every question we asked and he was so pleasant.  We ordered the Sunrise Snow Caps with the three dipping sauces, Delish!  Eggs, yummy hash browns and jalapeno bacon, Delish!  Everyone in our party loved their food.   The service from beginning to end.  And I mean end,  right to the parking lot.  My friend's driver cut himself.  I went back into the Cafe and they were so gracious. Coming to the vehicle with antiseptic wipes and band aids.  Need I say anymore?   Your rockin out Great Food, Great Service and employ Compassionate people.     Thank you to everyone!

1ACdlUT49qDIugOpya9rNg.text: Enjoyed the egg benedict. It was different, served on a bagel rather than an english muffin which I thought was delicious. Service was excellent. Definitely coming back when I'm back in the area again!

dkSFS7H0DKcFErm26ViDsA.text: I was really excited to go to this place because I've had great experiences in the past and I love breakfast but today was one of my worst experiences in a restaurant period. The server had a terrible attitude from the very beginning. I don't know why he would be patron facing with a bad attitude. The cashier was even clueless. I hope the owner reads this because I think training is in order. Customer Service 101.

Eut6Uk-U66-XoqoRB_U8Eg.text: The food here was delicious and the service was great.  The waiter welcomed us and upon finding out that it was our first time their,  offered us free muffin sample.

PynZkXrjicZnvuz8uJkmWA.text: This was our first visit to the cafe. Tiffany was our waitress, she did a wonderful job. Brandon one of the managers, came by to check on how we were enjoying our meal, and thanked us for coming in. We will be back.

8S529R8S9d8ycsAnkC8DJA.text: The OG.   This place is your classic diner spot located in a strip mall. Sadly this is the norm in Vegas, but it doesn't take away from the fact that this place is actually a great option for breakfast and brunch.  I highly recommend the snowcaps. Bagels cut into small pieces, pan fried in butter and topped with powdered sugar. These little sugar bombs will definitely shattered any diet plan you had going for you, so I would share these with your brunching buddy. Trust me, they give you plenty.   The omelets and benedict's here are very good and satisfying, no small portions at the Sunrise, but my favorite is the Fiesta Benedict. An open-faced bagel with jalapeno bacon, pepper jack cheese, two eggs and a spicy hollandaise sauce, this meal is amazing and really has a great kick of heat. The hollandaise sauce is rich and creamy and the eggs are cooked to that perfect point of soft/medium yolk.   I would avoid Sunday mornings and come right around 12:30pm, right as the crowds start to disband and there's no wait for a seat.   Brunch proper my friends.

0gfn13PC-0NBHSewDe3y8Q.text: Didn't feel like driving to far to go get breakfast so yelped  some nearby places . Very busy place so you know it's good but they do a great job getting you seated quick . The food was delicious I created my own omelette and had hash browns which were amazing . I choose to get a pancake and it was disgusting taste like it was just microwaved next time I'll stick to a bagel or toast . My boyfriend got French toast and he enjoyed it . The food was 5 stars our server was more like a 1 star very unengaged and a little bit on the arrogant side .

xN9UvL1Apa7MO2vwOLc_pA.text: Wow! What an oasis in a sea of Vegas excess. Menu choices included super healthy to super delicious banana syrup creations. Brooklyn Benedict was fresh and well made, and the addition of the house made sour cream citrus hollandaise had a nice soft kick that really was lovely and luxurious. The huevos rancheros wrap was fresh and not over stuffed or sloppy and the hash browns were crispy deliciousness. Freshly made coffee choices included Hawaiian hazelnut and the refills were forthcoming and I never saw the bottom of my mug. Great vibe and super clean and well maintained restroom (ladies I can vouch for, at least) lol! Great way to end a little Vegas dash!

7W9UJHlbWaqPfa0uML-T1g.text: 4.5 stars really. The only 1/2 star is held back for the long wait each time we go and occasionally the smoker that stands by your table if you have to sit outside.  However, the food and general customer service is really fab-u-lous.  We've had breakfast and lunch and each time everything is always good. I love the veggie omelet and the salads are great, too. My kids love the pancakes and French toast.

qQcMJH6be2Yjl9YAEwqP2w.text: Crunchberry French Toast. That's all I need in my life to keep me satisfied. ;p  Every time I come here with my sister, we like to get one sweet and one savory dish. I absolutely love that the server always asks if we want to split our meals! We seriously don't have to ask for extra plates because they almost always assume and are correct that we like to share each other's meals.  The Cajun Eggs Benny is super good too! I have knack for anything eggs benny, but I do crave that specifically.  Too bad I don't live close to OSC. I live on the NW side of town and only like to come here if I happen to be on the south visiting my sister.  Other than that, I'd highly recommend this restaurant for breakfast and brunch. I have yet to try their lunch menu.

mFWI_t69nnw2n8HQ70Q3mg.text: Order the Cajun prime rib!!! It is such a fresh take on the same old tired eggs Benny that everyone in vegas serves. It is on a fresh Keiser roll, loaded with thin prime rib and hollandaise sauce, with a side of fresh potatoes. Wife and I shared it and also got the crunch berry French toast which was a trip down memory lane bc my favorite sugar Leiden cereal was captain crunch crunch berries! Next time if I get it I will definitely tell them to layoff the powdered sugar a bit but still a very unique and tasty dish. It comes with a blueberry cream  cheese dalop and syrup. The coffee here is pretty good and the service was super friendly and he was on point throughout the entire breakfast. Also the patio is dog friendly so feel free to bring Rover with you on your next breakfast outting when you give this place a try.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime rib Benny and crunch berry French toast

UfE55NrZUvTDb6fCi3V58A.text: First impression: From the outside of the building it looks like just another diner. Although, from the amount of people standing and sitting waiting for a table, it looks a bit small. Don't let that impression fool you. It's of a very decent size inside.  It took us about 30 min to get seated, during Sunday morning Brunch.  Staff: Staff were on cue, bussing tables, seating guests and taking orders. When we got seated our server came over right away to get our drinks(Wish I could remember his name....he was awesome). Within seconds, not kidding, we had our coffee and we're looking at their menu.   ((I will add on a personal opinion, I believe the physical size of the menu is too big, should slim it down a bit. Kind of gets in the way. ))  After about 3 minutes he came back to take our order. I was quite surprised at his consistently. It was a very full house and he was right on top of things.  We gave our order and he was off to the kitchen !  Cleanliness: Even with the amount of people in the restaurant, they managed to keep it clean. I did not see any trash on the floors (I was looking for this review), the tables were cleared promptly, and of there was a spill...the staff were on top of it.   Food: Definitely good quality food. I got a  create-your-own omelette. It was delicious. Proof in the pictures ;). It was cooked perfectly, and I had zero complaints about the quality of it. They have these little Cinnamon French toast bite things....OMG...out of this world.   The owner ended up making his way over to the table to refill our coffee. That in it self made the whole experience for me. We talked for a few minutes about hockey, and you could tell he had passion, not only about the sport but about his business. Him stopping by the table and filling out coffee, shows that he genuinely cares about the customer experience. A move that is all to forgotten this day in age to show the appreciation and caring of the restaurant.  I've been here twice in the last few years and will return for sure. If you're looking for a mom and pop place to get some good breakfast or lunch....this is it. Check out this cafe....

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Forgot to take a picture prior....one bite...it&#39;s was so delicious I forgot....  Proof there used to be delicious food there....LOL

8w8mdob14tNX4swAQtrPLQ.text: I thought this place was good - it was a typical, traditional spot for American-style breakfast/brunch. We had a table of 3 and ordered a few different items and all was good. The Cinnamon Swirl French Toast was a bit of a stand-out since it was something unique and interesting. They serve big portions and that was a nice way to start that day.   I'd visit again if I were in the area.

-QRKxWmfBSvs6HfM24IfPA.text: First time coming here and I must say the French toast was amazing. I got The Ultimate and it was amazing!!! To top it off the service by our waitress Kelly was amazing!! Will definitely be coming back every time we are in town!!

8Ip53apLPcI00Llxqyh25Q.text: One word. WOW.  My boyfriend and I stopped by at this Cafe last weekend during our Vegas trip on a Sunday afternoon. There were a lot of people waiting to be seated but we only waited about 25 minutes to get seated. Once we sat, the waiter came by and took our order. He was pretty fast and overall great! (Wish I could have remembered his name)  We tried the Snow Caps to start and OMG THOSE THINGS ARE THE BEST TINY FRENCH TOAST IVE EVER HAD!!! Definitely try them with the icing + raspberry dipping it'll make it 10x better than syrup! (He recommended) the food was overall great, I love mom and pop shops like these and everyone there was very attentive and kind! The waiter even stopped by with refilled drinks before we could even ask for a refill which was AMAZING. Love love love this place! I can't wait to be back for more!

yVjiYh02INdha0az163kHQ.text: the crunchberry french toast is a sugar wonderland that my 9 year old self dreamed my parents would've allowed me to have for breakfast.  also.. jalapeno bacon extra crispy and flavored coffee

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crunchberry French Toast + jalapeno bacon

I7NvnA192-s3cYuyrnUBdw.text: This is our NEW FAV BREAKFAST GO TO PLACE! Thank you Tyler for taking tome to chat with us You and everyone made us feel at  HOME. We will be back for lunch!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wonderful food prices are  very reasonable
Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh clean food is #1 for us. Pic of owner and us  He is A PASSIONATE CHEF/OWNER MAKES A DIFFERENCE!!!

i-tQkldN85tKNAZxTp6lHA.text: I'm not sure why, but after eating here probably 6-7 years ago I never came back. After eating breakfast here recently I'm really kind of bummed that I waited so long to return.   The eggs benny are off the charts. I love the fact that they use a bagel instead of an English muffin. Two reasons, one, bagels are awesome, far more awesome than silly little English muffins. Two, you get more grub, because bagels are bigger, and better. The breakfast potatoes that they come with are really good too, mixed with onions and peppers. On this day I chose my benny to be over an everything bagel. One small critique, it could use a little more hollandaise, because that stuff is bomb.   Pricing is decent here, along the lines of other breakfast establishments. It always gets me paying almost the same for breakfast as you do for dinner. But hey, good food is good food. Life is too short to eat bad breakfastes.   Service is always outstanding and the iced tea is tasty!

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict are bomb diggity

npeV9KnHFKW5Gtl2mQe9YA.text: Tried sunrise for the 1st time.  Huge menu place was packed.  I tried the snow caps with syrup for dipping sauce. Seems like a bagel diced up into French toast bites. Pretty good. - And the corned beef hash  was also good. Service was ok -  A Negative is they don't take Amex.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

N-z0bkYvmU7B69t8fAqJsQ.text: Matthew the manager was unbelievable, I won't visit this place ever again. Ordered an omelette with cheese, that had to go back. Matthew comes and grabs my whole plate, so now my potatoes are off getting cold, then brings it back to sit getting cold. He just needs to work on people skills. He never even waited to hear my concern about snatching the plate up so fast.. Then he came by the table to harass me more. Asking me my personal business about leaving a review.. totally ridic.. The food was ok, the only plus. I won't be back though. So many other places to eat from in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The ultimate French toast
Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Make your own omelette.

xsd2QLMEvgjx_y43vgyDIQ.text: Usually this place is super friendly. I've always loved their service.. but my girlfriend just called trying to set an order for pick up and they picked up the phone, told her no and hung up? I'm appalled from this behavior towards their customers :( Don't think I'll be coming back anytime soon. Please do better.

fBMiCG7VoVrrKfuLuuNkNA.text: I woke up this morning thinking hard on whether I should go buy a BLT or go to the store and buy the items to make it.   After a long 3 hours of debating and looking for diners and cafe. I finally decided to try Sunrise cafe out. I was craving for a lot.   I ordered a BLT: extra Bacon, add mushrooms, add avocado, add grilled onions. With a side salad with Caesar dressing and a cup of bananas and blueberries. I knew my order was complicated. However they were able to accommodate my special order.   I paid a little under $20 for my meal . And omg they had Whoopie pies! I never had them but pumpkin was what caught my eye and made my mouth water.   The food smelled amazing. I was ready to devour everything in the car because the aroma was soooo good. But guess what I couldn't resist? A bite of that same whoopie pie! I had to stop myself from eatin because I wanted to eat my BLT. LET ME TELL YOU THIS!!! THIS WAS THW BEST BLT THAT WAS EVER MADE IN MY LIFE, ESPECIALLY WITH CRAVING ADDITIONS!  One thing I was unsatisfied about what that my side of blueberries and bananas was that the blue berries weren't fresh, it kinda tasted frozen or preserved.   OVERALL, I ENJOYED my food and I DEFINITELY will COME BACK AND TRY OTHER THINGS !

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bananas and blueberries (berries were either preserved or frozen)
Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Custom BLT: Extra bacon, add grilled onions, mushrooms, avocado &amp;&amp; Swiss chesse
Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side salad (has olives) with Caesar dressing &amp;&amp; the amazing Pumpkin whoopie piee

5MT7i0gW-GkXIJb1KTl-Cw.text: Love this place! Good food and great service!! Loved my Beni and my friends all loved their food. The pancake was yummy and I'm not a pancake person!  My friends said their French toast was really good. We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ALMapvfPlbp9bOGTfT64Jw.text: What I liked the most were the shirts that every server wore: "Love never fails."

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A collection of crosses bless us as we enjoy lunch.
Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love never ends
Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CgndEc06rFGZkAjatGK5HQ.text: This is one of my favorite places to go for breakfast! There is a pretty large menu. You have to wait a little bit to get in most of the time, especially on Sundays. The service has always been good. The food has always been good. I love the atmosphere here. I'm a basic eggs and avocado with bacon kind of girl. So can't say that I've ordered much else.

-jrm7FHQkupg0lZXYZIKJg.text: 2 stars . Would've been at least 3-4  if the fact that I didn't feel outcasted . Not many mixed races here . Was never greeted until last minute by a woman who was very sweet and nice . Food was good , did not like how the workers were looking at me & my friend the moment we walked in / even paying our checks being that we were one of the very few or if only colored people around during the time . Workers especially the Men I'm sorry BOYS were snobby just as much as the customers dining . Tragic .   Which brings to problem number two : while walking inside , to pay for the tab ( mind u it's my first time here  ) don't know How things worked around there and the host podium literally takes up / blocks the walk way so I didn't know where to pay which is why I was being patience and nice to even wait to ask . Once I hand him the receipt , he gives us an attitude and it's not one where he's trying to be slick his face just went straight while rolling his eyes and says " you're paying " we said yes and he just goes " OK ?" While rolling his eyes and his arms extended . Worst employee ever , can't even fake a good customer service at least. Don't plan on coming back .

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greek &amp; California  omelet .

FsxVcHKAlHCHw0RW89lHNA.text: This is in a strip mall kinda location. They have plenty of parking. This place was packed when I got there. The inside is bright and has a cafe feel. Now just as everyone talked about in their reviews the sunrise cafe snow caps are great. I have never even thought about fryin up bagels and then add sugar haha. I liked they used a variety bagels. I also had an omelet I don't like when places put the cheese on top but that's me. Other than that it was decent.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omelette
Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunrise Snow Caps

wpGK82siG-4WBsEfMjwGAQ.text: We stopped at this place on a Wednesday around 10am, on our way to the Grand Canyon West, super busy but we were seated right away. Our server was awesome, very friendly and nice. We tried their snow caps- bagels tossed in cinnamon sugar, so good! They had vanilla flavored coffee which was delicious as well. We will be back on our next yearly trip. Food did take a while so be prepared to relax and enjoy talking with family and friends.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jacobs slammin platter- can&#39;t go wrong!

RzeI9qHYcz3Lkf7CmdDjrg.text: This place has been consistently good each time I've come out to Henderson. I got this breakfast Benedict this time that had sausage and this jalapeno sauce on it. It was by far the most flavorful breakfast beni I've had. The service is always so welcoming. Our server Savannah went above and beyond with our orders. She was super sweet and friendly. I'll definitely be coming back again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bueno Beni
Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Philly cheesesteak has cream cheese in it. Best philly I&#39;ve had.

NDelEPxmlOgV2nxoqFH88w.text: Very good place for the price. Have not ever seen eggs Benedict with jalapenos and salsa verse sauce. Ordered it and it is awesome. My wife had their pancakes and they were good. Wait staff is courteous, and very friendly!

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bueno Beni with Kaiser roll - spicy and good
Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 pancakes

AgPH6D3dXgwZX9iftrneVg.text: I went on a Sunday with my gf. It was extremely busy,definitely call ahead. We waited for about 20-30 mins even though we called ahead though.   It was worth the wait in my opinion. I love French toast and there French toast had crispy edges. THAT IS A MUST. A lot of places have really soggy French toast and that just doesn't add anything.

zbrwjiWo8SDHG0OIQMmGug.text: Wonderful breakfast. Came her with friends, we had great service and great food. We will definitely be back. I had there yummy buffalo omlette.!

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zxRT_HKDgOZVaY9CPXIKTw.text: I yelped for a great breakfast spot as soon as we landed in Vegas and this place did not disappoint.  The food was excellent and the people were very friendly and attentive.  It was so good that we went back again the next day.  I highly recommend!

Ohgl2bZxhztdIhUjWxrqnw.text: Best breakfast omlette ever! I got the California omlette & it was delicious! The attention to detail is awesome. Friendly service, great food!

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. California omlette

Rl50lsPxfjJVYgBshMqhlQ.text: We were looking for a non "Vegas" brunch, but knew good food was required. Based on the 4 star 200+ yelp reviews we gave this place a shot. There was a wait, which is expected on a Sunday for brunch, the service was friendly and quick.  The food though.... OMG... Stuff it all into my mouth right now! From the amazing crunch berry french toast to the kickass, fill up my mouth until I want to die of happiness Cajun prime rib eggs Benedict, we were impressed and overjoyed to have come! The coffee is even pretty damn good!  The cherry on top? They have a little bucket of toys for the kids to choose from at the end of the meal. It was just a little thing that leaves a lasting impression. Next time I'm in Vegas I'll seek this place out again.

dsRh4FWEkkr4NbrB4ap7fg.text: Stopped in at 9 AM on Sunday morning. Party of 6 was seated immediately. The service was spot on. Never had to ask twice for anything. Very attentive and right on the mark. As far as the food, Phil Robertson would call it Yupified.  It was not your bacon/eggs/toast  type place. They have that, but, their specialties are their wraps, benedicts, and omelets. Their menu was an adventure. It takes a great deal of time to review the menu because of the vast selection. Food was great, as ordered, hot and fast. These people do it right. Great job!!!!!

vwq30qzIxMtQFk4wOEj05g.text: Great breakfast place! I regularly get the locks & bagels on an everything bagel (so good). Every once in a while I'll branch out & try something different, today I had banana cream pie pancakes...WOW! The bananas are sliced & cooked Into the batter, then topped with slices & pecans. They were so moist & delish I didn't bother with syrup! They come with whipped maple butter, it's so yummy you can simply eat it! Not that I did, just saying it's an option! The eggs are always cooked exactly as ordered. It's not rocket science but it does seem to be a lot to ask in many restaurants to get your eggs as ordered, but that's not the case here. On the weekends they serve homemade oatmeal, it's a big draw so go early because once it's gone, it's gone. My hubby loves the stuff. FYI there's always a wait, but it's so worth it.

ypuDsLk87VfQP8WOlyNeLw.text: I wanted to have a good breakfast with my family and experience home style cooking.  My breakfast was good, but it was nothing to brag about.  My pancakes, sausage, and ham seemed to have come from pre-packaging that didn't get the authentic made from scratch taste.  Minus 1 point for that.  Another thing that bothered me was the employees all seem dressed to casual to know who's who from the guest.  As a business they should be dressed all in uniformity to each other and be well groomed to clearly identify themselves to the public eye.  Several servers looked as of they had just rolled out of bed, forgot to shave, and comb there hair.  This is just one of pet peeves since I own a retail establishment.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jacobs sampler...some of the food seemed to be pre made packaged food.  Example: sausage, ham and pancakes.

V-57AWskwpDJWELkL_5cXQ.text: YUM!  The meals here are SO good!  I had the corned-beef hash, which was out of this world!  I like it better than most of the other breakfast places, because the portions are not ridiculous.  The food is always good, no matter what you get.  General Yum!

YEowUQdG-GLgK1JWwegoQA.text: We found this place using yelp. We enjoyed our meals and the service was excellent. The menu has a large selection and I'm told you can't go wrong with any selection.  The food is delicious.

FF-WEqF8TfTC36E5GS-XZw.text: Pretty darn good.  This place was packed on Sunday around lunch time.  Food was bomb.  $28 for the hubs & me for breakfast.  Portions are huge.  There are a lot of Christian decorations...crosses on the walls, bible verses, etc. if you're into that kinda thing.

O7h9fs9YKOrPbt98wn9yVA.text: My favorite breakfast spot. I always go for the French Toast. Everything is amazing here. Great staff, great atmosphere, great food. Always worth the wait.

Ih3JkEnQP4wMnVVCMhmtAw.text: A friend of ours took us here and we loved the place at the first bite of the Omelette we ordered. Service was great, atmosphere was super and the food was awesome! We came back the next day and planning to eat here again when we come to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Davezilla Omelette
Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Californian with extra bacon

oIs1h5-7vxNjR4oJIO-XuQ.text: Very lovely breakfast place that I discovered while visiting my family in Vegas. I had the vegetarian eggs Benedict with a light hollandaise sauce and it was great. The staff was extremely nice/efficient and I would definitely return when I'm in the area again.

74whUqNRb2ZD8g3vo3rAYw.text: Not bad!  Another Vegas-style place that automatically brings straws with water and probably doles out styrofoam for leftovers, but decent food. There were 4 of us, and we were all happy. The service was good and attentive, and the food was decent for one of those diner spots.  I had a hard time wrapping my brain around the portion sizes again. I ordered a veggie omelet that, in addition to being huge, came with a side of hash browns equally as huge. AND an entire BAGEL! It might have been offered as my toast option, but wow. A whole bagel! I think I made it through about 60-65% of what was in front of me and left overly stuffed. My partner had a breakfast burrito with a much more sane portion size and much easier to finish. It was super-tasty except for the TOO many jalapenos. He picked them off and was still suffering through the spice. So rec'd only for those who love that kick.

uNGRafKB7JGkk-h3hnmDhA.text: This is the breakfast place we come back to most often, and it has my favorite breakfast in the Valley:  Jacob's Slammin' Platter.  For a place with many healthy options, this is a behemoth of a breakfast:  eggs, potatoes, sausage, bacon, canadian bacon, silver dollar pancakes, and a bread (I always choose the everything bagel toasted).  80% of the time I order this, the other 20% I get the crispy creamy wrap, an egg/bacon/cream cheese wrap.  Again served with their potatoes, which are fantastic when ordered extra crispy.  My wife typically gets Chester's Way, their corned beef hash dish.  This is another huge meal, we always take some home even with me helping...  I would arrive earlier in the day if possible, the wait can get long at high peak times on the weekend due to its popularity.  Also, they do run out of bread choices, which we found out the hard way a few times.  During nice weather, sitting outside on the patio can be fun, but it's RIGHT by the parking lot.  So, car noise/exhaust can be an issue. Dogs are welcome on the patio.  Service is fantastic.  They have a lot of servers that have been there for years, which I think is indicative of how they run the business.  Be advised it's good for kids, but no changing table in the bathrooms.

zkBP3CWmJX2sT2h0sTvtTQ.text: Pancakes are just pancakes. Came in mainly for their Banana Cream Pancakes with dulce de leche cream. But they are more like regular ol' dry pancakes I can make at home with chopped bananas on top. The dulce cream tasted bland, nothing special. Good location good service but food is not up to par. Will not be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. California Omelette with Steak
Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Cream Pancakes

O6QH4Io7TR54LpETm35vKg.text: Awesome food, very friendly staff. I had the Greek omelet and it was the best I have ever had. Super fast food delivery as we ordered and we're served in less than 10 minutes. It was surprising because the place was packed.  I highly recommend this place.

Cqa08pb0m_ClDLBZr-_jew.text: The food here was amazing. Easy to find the cafe, we were seated quickly. The staff was very quick to get our drinks and recommend food for us first timers. We had the Cajun Prime Rib Beni and they were awesome. My daughter had the corned beef and the wife had the prime rib wrap. All were delicious. The pancakes were fluffy and delicious. Could not have been happier. Thank you for a great breakfast. Next trip, we'll be back.

OAjrvXz4YzYKpuUhEf7ujw.text: Well, again all of you Yellpers haven't let me down. Ordered an egg white omelette with turkey, spinach, pepper jack & avocado. OH MY GOD! How can you take something so simple and make it taste so good? Highly recommend. Ask for Tiffany. She is outstanding.

pbdKkd7EGvCRKHSU1wlulg.text: Perfect moms and pops spot for breakfast. Great service, fresh and tasty food. What more could you ask for?

E1UMmwNNNqq0zvwRzQlMVQ.text: Top quality! The omelette are delish, the home fries are the best and the bagels are awesome!! Make sure to order a grilled blue berry muffin. There is usually a wait on the weekend but it goes quick and once you're seated you get your food quickly. They also usually have a flavored coffee. The staff is really nice and accommodating. A definite must on this side of town!

Zm9MtL_zn3t0P0G6GNOL1w.text: Went over to Sam's Club with some friends of mine and decided to buy them breakfast, so we stopped at Sunrise.  It was Saturday and of course crowded but we didn't have to wait. We were seated inside immediately. The service was great and we received our food fast and hot.  I am an eggs Benedict nut and I love Sunrise's selection with their twist on this breakfast classic. My other favorite breakfast place is GVR 's Pancake house and I will have to say even though Sunrise isn't as fancy as Pancake house, their food is just as good with less of a wait.

OkqFw5jujLTgUTg8xmjSTg.text: My favorite breakfast place in Vegas. A total mom and pap shop....I only wish it was open later!!

1GautN-ZOEQmqbgyqWC77w.text: When Hash House is just too far away,  too much money and too much food.  This is your healthy alternative.  Whereas Hash House is that cute girl you spend too much money on,  this place is like the loyal girl next door thats always there for you,  but easy to take for granted. Luckily Ive realized my folly and always make a stop when I am back in town.   A very diverse menu,  but you can make your own breakfast and its not a problem-UNLIKE other places where a custom order brings that underhanded chain of sighs from the server to the first line cook all the way down until it ends back up on your table.  Now it feels like your custom order is weighed down with a little extra guilt or sarcasm.  Back to the lecture at hand,  I highly recommend this place when you want a break from the usual breakfast joints,  the buffets and want something REAL.   Come with friends,  the coffee is always topped off and you'll walk away wondering why you didn't come any sooner.

Y4fTQCuIZWnF3WFpxI1JMw.text: Sunrise Cafe is a must go!!!!!!! awesome customer service and amazing food! My wife and i eat here almost every sunday after church!

28cKpx-x5sQJXpfv4SCWXg.text: We had family visiting and staying in Henderson who wanted to meet for breakfast. I, being the faithful Yelper that I am, looked for a good spot to try since our favorites are near us in SW Las Vegas. The Original Sunrise Cafe is a solid place and got the job done. They were very busy but still managed to get out food out  quickly and be attentive to our needs throughout the meal. The menu selections are pretty standard for breakfast with some spins on classic items like their "Bueno" and "Brooklyn" eggs benedict. I ordered the "Garden of Eden" omelet, and thought it was decent, it needed some love...or maybe just salt. I really liked the potatoes. They were shredded, but in a wider form than I've seen before, and yummy. My partner in crime got the corn beef hash and ate the whole thing. So, I say give it a try and you probably will not be disappointed; but, I think I'll save the gas next time I want breakfast and go somewhere closer to home.

-36gZcnxtGdUbzGOIlx9tg.text: Where do I start.  My girlfriend and I are regulars here.  The food is healthy, fresh and full of flavor.  I really like to get up on saturday or sunday, and go there before I start my day.  The food doesn't make you feel lethargic or weigh you down.  Steve "O" is the best server, but everyone is great as well.  It is owned by a husband and wife, and they make sure everything is perfect.  They always have time in their hectic schedule to stop and say hi to you.  Highly recommend!!

mf78HEorAO10zbXepQ7hmQ.text: BEST BREAKFAST PLACE EVER! My family and I, including our german shepard come here almost everyday! They have the best staff who always greats us with a smile. I reccomend the garden of eden and the traditional french toast! My two favorites ! we will continue going to this place. There are a few breakfast/lunch cafe's around henderson and the greenvalley area, but none of them compare to Sunrise. I never had a bad meal there.

IAjIOdFenDP6lvS589et4w.text: When you need to get off the strip its worth the drive. Food was tasty, fresh and fast. Many Vegetarian options and friendly staff

-Lv_D6jOgspTrRzXVfjemA.text: Great food great service! The food is so refreshing. Worst part about this place is everything looks so good its hard to decide what to order! Didn't catch his name but our server was very attentive as well as friendly.

e94wu3G_LQ6flJrgJSQXog.text: One of My favorite places for breakfast in Vegas, had a bacon burger for the first time and it was really good on a pretzel roll, BUT  the whole family was sick the next day and that was the only thing we ate all day, NOT sure if they were the cause since we all had something different, and I will still go back, again and again. :)

bgvCbF9_-FtVTBBJvF_Ssg.text: This is not the place you go for a greasy breakfast . It's the organicfreerangelocallygrownsustainable kind of place, sort of. It was good and not expensive and the service was efficient. Definetly a locals place off the strip.

q3GEvrvXWsqMDi7v6hMQCg.text: I took my boyfriend this time he said he loves loves this place  the corn beef hash was delicious he said & he ordered for since he was paying the French toast that had such a nice texture to it good call . We sat outside it was nice & the service was great. We will be back I'm glad my boyfriend talked me into giving this place 1 more shot .

4owM33jWroj--fATnZd_NQ.text: We decided to eat off the strip for most of our meals, and Yelp brought us here for breakfast.  It was great!  Reasonable prices for good sized portions of well made, fresh food.  It's not glitzy, but that's the charm, it's run by a guy who cares and he spreads that philosophy to his staff.  Our coffee cups were never empty, and our bellies were full.  I had the Jacob slam (or something like that), and it was delicious; my eggs were perfectly done.  I can't tell you the times I order "over hard" and get a runny mess.  This was just right.  It came with a small fruit bowl (or potatoes), bagel, sausage patty, canadian bacon, and strip bacon, all of which were cooked just right.  We had some really average, or below average food in Vegas, and we didn't expect that one of our best meals would be at this unassuming cafe in a strip mall.  I recommend coming here for a breakfast in a pleasant environment, that wont cost you much, and the food is good!

85boP013Gu0gDaaeBB4AcQ.text: i was in Las Vegas for a night and wanted to get breakfast somewhere on the way back to Phoenix. We didn't want to hassle with the strip, and I was really in the mood for a French themed hoorah, so I used yelp to find somewhere in SE LV, and O M G. I could not have been more happier with any other breakfast! I got the Garden of Eden omelette ( I think that's what it was called?) without olives and mushies cause I don't fly with that. It was so amazing. I was thoroughly impressed with the service, the food, and the large cup of coffee that my server kept hot. The meal came with delicious taters, and a bagel too. I usually never finish a whole breakfast, but I couldn't resist finishing this one. It was the best breakfast I have had in a really long time. My boyfriend got the bagel with lox or whatever it is and reported that it was very delicious as well. 5 stars for being the most absolutely perfect breakfast after one night in Vegas. We left on a really good impression.

_oFRfhJZKJP2u4hwoPElGg.text: From the moment I walked in the door to the moment I left, service was fantastic.  EVERYONE was smiling and friendly and courteous... my waitress was quick, efficient, and very good at following up without being too pushy or too in my face.  I kept my order pretty basic as I don't eat pancakes, bagels, or any of the other breakfast goodies... but I can say that the menu options looked AWESOME.  Buffalo chicken omelet with blue cheese?  Are you kidding me?  Can I roll up inside and eat my way out?  I opted for a build-your-own with steak, avocado, and jalapenos.  Jalapenos.  The only time I've seen jalapenos as an option for something is pizza.  And now they are in my omelet... and they are good!  I would love to come back and try one of the menu omelet creations - I can't imagine anything tasting bad here.  Another big plus - the giant box of hot tea selections!  Its so nice to see options for tea, especially at breakfast.  +one star JUST for the tea!  Next time I'm in the area, I will make effort to get back here for breakfast.  Prices, service, atmosphere - all a nice change of pace from the LV Strip.

BvCoD265__zOF86_BYAggg.text: Very good, food and service Callie was awesome! Pleasantly suprizied

XokSFllQbnOObnaatPh61A.text: This place is great. I'm a chef in Las Vegas and I know how hard it is to do breakfast well. They do it very very well! Food is healthy, flavorful and the staff and owners are top notch.

b6Qr2EntX2TW3mlkJIFkBg.text: The food quality and portion size was awesome. The speed of getting seated left something to be desired. It seemed like there was always an empty table that sat open for 5+ minutes and there was a long line to be seated. We went on a Sarurday morning so I expected a wait. The server was good, not great and not bad especially considering how busy it was.

gOkCQ4uBmSFy4NMGkOWLBg.text: healthiest breakfast place and it's all around ten dollars.  get the garden of eden.  sprouts, avocado, and all the goodies.  I mean you don't need to be a health nut but, who wants to consume 1000 calories for breakfast.  Not me...

eVG4gOpaa0PgdEtvzPZbnA.text: So Tim and I were staying at the new Aria Hotel this past weekend. As much as I love Vegas Casinos when it comes to food I still prefer a casual hole-in-the-wall locals kinda place whenever I can get it. So I yelped "locals breakfast" on my blackberry and this was one of the top choices.   Was an easy 10 minute drive from the south end of the strip.  Great place.  Very friendly and relaxed service.  Great fresh food.   Lotsa unique twists on traditional favorites here. I especially likes that they had about a dozen different "Egg White" omelets to choose from. Create your own too of course.   If I lived locally I'd have Sunrise on my regular breakfast rotation no doubt.

P5X13LHal0I_yuK19Xft1A.text: Great food and atmosphere. Service is a little slow but I understand breakfast is hard to keep up with! Would definitely recommend this place. Yum!

B5L4lSSshTCwX9Dxn4WORQ.text: Excellent service and food! By far the best tasting AND affordable food in Vegas. It's not too far away from the strip and its worth the drive. We went on Saturday and Sunday cause it was so good. The omelette was fresh, not too heavy and the breakfast platter was just enough with the perfect size silver pancakes. Would definately recommend to anyone looking for a great place to eat breakfast or lunch.

F5bk0pCO475ma0jEt2bQIA.text: We stopped here on a visit to Las Vegas from California. The outside looks like nothing special. Just wait until you open the door! The restaurant is one large room. We were there on a Thursday at about ten AM. The place was busy but we were seated almost immediately. The menu had a lot of choices for a place that's only open for breakfast and lunch. i ordered the eggs Benedict. The price was at least three dollars cheaper than the same dish where I live. Our water glass was immediately filled and it was filled, without asking, the whole time we were there. The same is True for the coffee. Along with the eggs, they served potatoes with onions. They were some of the best that I have ever tasted. The eggs were delicious. They were completely covered with sauce. In most restaurants I'm lucky if I get a spoonful! Our waiter, Jeff, was super friendly and very attentive. Now this is a real treat. I hate to say it but most of the wait staff in local restaurants here are rude or in an extreme hurry to get you out. Several other people came by to see how we were doing. There is no doubt that I will stop by here on my next trip to Vegas. If you're from California the land of the almighty dollar, you're in for a treat. By the way the restroom was spotless. I checked the grout. There wasn't a spot anywhere!

O6z26Dppmz-1JlZ-k660cA.text: Try all the Benedict's--they are all wonderful. Super fast service. Quality is fresh and food is deliciously prepared. Go see Jesse; he's the best!

jy4sl7O4ts1cRkzuq1Sxww.text: As long we are still talking about a place that serves comfort food at a quick service and inexpensive tab - Yeah, this place is awesome!  I went for Sunday brunch so we expected the wait.  Was told 15 min but seated within 5-10.  There are so many variations of omelets and all looking very interesting.  The best part is that they serve mostly egg white omelets!  I ordered the Garden of Eden based on the waitress' recommendation and i was very happy with it.  It's a regular spot for people workout at the near by gym.  Almost makes me fee like I did something good for my body too :p  This place doesn't have the Vegas grime, which scores big for me.

uW8AXl9g9S8EskYj9hluug.text: We visited this excellent cafe Christmas Eve with our friends who are locals but were also visiting for the first time. The cafe was highly recommended and now I see why. The food, service, parking were all excellent. Our server was absolutely exceptional and when we said we liked the slogan on his T Shirt, he gave us the shirt of his back!  I had the Big Fat Greek Omelette which was delicious although slightly salty but that's ok because it didn't diminish how much I enjoyed it.  Next time we're in Vegas, we'll be back.

mZyGoVntSFac329RydGqZg.text: Love the Davezilla. This is a great place for breakfast. Most of the egg dishes are made with egg whites.   This place is usually busy in the morning with folks coming over from the nearby Athletic Club. It's a good spot to sit, relax, eat a tasty breakfast and people watch. It's not uncommon for someone to bring there dog and eat outside. Not the best place if you are in a hurry or want solitude.

DxwGUpImxNpW2JnGZV-ILA.text: This place has great service, flavorful coffee, and yummy food. A nice place to get breakfast when in Vegas, also I nice little escape from the hustle of town. Highly recommend.

FPh3fbnZ3GixtnHHrLc2sQ.text: Thanks Yelpers! This is such a locals only spot! The food was incredible! Everything we ordered was awesome.. Next time we go to Vegas, this will be our breakfast spot.

OQWpmNyxrgG8MGVTeMUpbw.text: This place has the most amazing service that I've ever received and they are consistent.   Every staff member contributes to your overall experience so you are not waiting for anything.   One person seats you and gets your drink order,  then your waiter comes over to take your order.   If she's busy someone else brings your food out hot.   The bacon and hashbrowns are my favorite things to eat here .  They also have a wrap with a pancake on the inside. ..delicious. .I love this place

uuwBNhwvqP6fkDM4dPa_dw.text: Great Breakfast place - very busy but friendly staff! I ordered the Veggie Benedict w/the Everything Bagel. I would have preferred the bagel be toasted more & the tomato sliced thicker but the food was served pipping hot & with a smile! I'll definitely return & recommend the Original Sunrise Cafe!

ZBiP6ZMVT3F9UkdEafgDRA.text: Two words: jalapeno bacon. I don't know how they make it, but it's freaking delicious. This eventually became our go-to breakfast spot in Henderson. It's nothing fancy, but the food is tasty, and the service is so friendly. After only a few visits, the staff came to recognize us and remember our favorite dishes. Of course, our favorite of all time turned out to be the fiesta benedict, featuring said jalapeno bacon and a spicy hollandaise sauce. I also really appreciated their flexibility; anytime I wanted to customize anything on the menu (such as, say, adding jalapeno bacon) it was always no problem. I loved that all their benedicts came on bagels rather than muffins, and that we could get sliced bananas as a side. Other than their benedicts, we really enjoyed their morning wraps and omelettes (especially the Davezilla omelette with amazing garlic sauce). We even went for lunch there once and had some delicious burgers. Now that we've moved, we certainly miss this place!

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Athens burger
Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. S.O.B. burger
Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. vegi beni

W8bBlC4V0dfcrgvL7OcLqg.text: One of my favorite breakfast spots! Learned about this after moving to this side of town and if i wouldve known about it sooner, i wouldve drove from the othrr side of town to eat here. Great food, friendly staff, indoor or outdoor seating...just an overall good food experience.

hSMVQ7MSh6B0OgPxFQFO8g.text: I feel like a million bucks, today after waking up after a big party that lasted till the wee hours, I needed a good breakfast but need to be in a bathing suit on monday...so...here is Sunrise Cafe...right up the street and open and willing to serve breakfast at noon.  I really couldn't ask for anything better. I ordered a FUZE drink and a power wrap on whole wheat, Chicken, egg whites, salsa, and Swiss cheese. SO YUMMY!! I did get the potatoes instead of fruit, (I have to be a little bad right??) It was under ten dollars and they have super nice staff, a bright room that needs big sunglasses if your there for a weekend brunch and amazing healthy food!! I'm hooked and will be there weekly! Thank you!!!

s2Y_HZKiV2KkTtsy5m5SEg.text: Sad to say we will not be eating here as often due to the fact they stopped buying sour cream wtf?! Food has always been great and sour cream may not be that much of a deal breaker to some people but I don't enjoy breakfast with out it :(

J2ibi2yy1IlavkVj4ZUbyg.text: Great service, friendly people, and good food.  I had the vegetarian eggs benedict, and it was delicious. My boyfriend had the corned beef hash, which he was assured was homemade. However when he got it, he found out it was actually a mix of homemade and canned.  But in spite of that one odd thing, it was all very tasty and we'd definitely go back.

zy7akFQ0baRniDOZM56SuQ.text: After a late night out, there are only a couple things that can motivate me to roll out of bed -- Sunrise Cafe being one of them. I consider myself a vegetable freak and this is one of the rare breakfast places where you can find genuinely good veggies in a lot of the main entrees.   The omelettes are praise worthy and although the Garden of Eden could be tempting for you health enthusiasts I would recommend the Davezilla. The veg-overload in the Garden of Eden is hardcore for even me but the Davezilla is still healthy with some spice to offset the bland.   I have never been disappointed with the create your own salad and whenever anyone at my table gets the signature muffin I hear about it for the rest of the meal. They look delicious and always come out piping hot! If one of my friends was writing this they would rave for hours.... Maybe I should just try one?!  If you don't get there early there could be a wait but nothing unbearable. I love the outdoor seating and I think it's great that they have a mini 'treasure chest" for kids to pick a treat out of.  Overall, I LOVE THIS PLACE! I have yet to find a breakfast place that can top it.

_Z9VhuzdTGTG6rOMeoJBLQ.text: Wow... awesome breakfast! My friend told me to check out the place. It looked super packed when we got there but surprisingly it was only a 10 minute wait, but we actually got sat in 7 or less. Our server was great too. His name was Mike (Michael) and he was the best! He brought our drinks out quickly, asked if we wanted to order, checked back to see if we had questions, suggested certain items (one of which we ordered), and provided continuous great service. The banana granola french toast is to DIE FOR! So good. Everything was really good. Wonderful variety of items and priced very reasonable.   Looking food a good breakfast... GO HERE!

NAn5FWqrB5ymW96r3ORSWQ.text: Friends suggested Sunrise Cafe since they allow dogs on the patio.  We have brunch here every weekend just for that reason.  The California omelet is my favorite.

66N_Z5SCkJdcoCzUQdAzqA.text: We decided to try something new out of our norm due to the reviews of this place. We walked in and were immediately hit with a wall of noise and chatter. It was very difficult to hear each other, or to even think.   I had the original eggs Benedict, and he ordered the classic breakfast.  Eggs Benedict: the eggs were not poached, and you could tell that they had touched a frying pan. The hollandaise sauce was a little lackluster, and lacked flavor. The ham was nothing to rant or rave about.  The classic breakfast: something that you can easily make at home. The bacon was a little funky tasting, and did not leave him wanting more.  When the waitress left the bill, she realized I had barely touched my plate and asked if it was all right. Not wanting confrontation, or expecting anything for free, I stated it was OK. She asked me to be honest with her, at which point I stated that the bagel was the star of the dish. She quickly took the plate to someone in the back, who then quickly came out and apologized, and ended up taking the meal off the ticket. I certainly appreciate the gesture, but I was also willing to pay.   Overall, we won't be returning.

DhbQ6Co5PC8-uHNL4Nc-Fg.text: We stopped for breakfast just by chance at The OSC and couldn't have been happier. The staff was super attentive and the food was so good. Must try the breakfast potatoes and the the Sunrise Snowcaps!

WNneMv4oIeqD73mm33HmRg.text: Oh.my.god This was the best breakfast we have had in a long time! I had the Davezilla omelet and my husband had the Cajun Prime Rib eggs Benedict. While my omelet was delicious I was so jealous of my husbands! The meat was tender and the sauce was out of this world. All the eggs and meat were piled on top of garlic toast which really sealed the deal. They have a huge menu with breakfast and lunch selections The decor in the restaurant is very eccentric. They also have abstract art paintings on the wall for sale. There are a lot of religious pieces inside. It didn't bother me at all, but I can see how it would be a little overbearing for some. We were quick to be seated and the staff was beyond friendly. Even though they were busy we got in and out in under an hour!

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime Rib Benedict
Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Davezilla omelet!

n5cj28vFre6Vn-N_FPvv-Q.text: Seriously HAVE TO SPOT when I come into town!  The attentiveness of the staff is above and beyond what I see on my day to day travels for work.  It is a delight to have the family type atmosphere with the food that goes above and beyond what I usually get to experience.    It is hard to decide between the Brooklyn Beni, Glens Wrap, simplicity of the Power Wrap, pancakes and French toast (I am not going to pinpoint my favorites because it's unfair to pick your favorite child), and I am not going to start on the sandwiches I've had the privilege of trying from here for lunch.  Sorry/ not sorry for not taking pictures.  Who has time for that nonsense it's food for crying out loud!?  Get in my belly already!    Already looking forward to my next work trip.  They need to have an east coast location; as their roots so plainly describe on their menu.

6zv6tk1TiEnOB3ePvJNBWg.text: Great place for breakfast!! BEST bagels in town!  We will be returning for lunch!  Service is fantastic.

ge4paDCGOa5G1nROtRGKjg.text: Very delicious breakfast! Went twice in one week while in a mini vacay to Vegas. They also have very good service. Definitely bookmark'ed this one!

n3pTu490wZvuiWvEpsTwvg.text: We come here more for breakfast than lunch. The best time to come is during the week or before the brunch crowd on the weekends. You'll be sure to be searching for a parking spot and be waiting to be seated if you come later in the morning as this place is family friendly, beefcake friendly from LVAC next door, and dog friendly.  Their menu has been exactly the same as far as I can remember but is consistently executed well. They have a create your own omelette section to accompany your standard breakfast options. There are some creative French toast selections and benedicts served on bagels. If you're leaning toward something on the sweet side, I would recommend one of the French toasts. On our most recent visit, I went with the Crunchberry French toast which definitely brought back some childhood memories, with actual crushed Crunchberries. My wife created her own omelette which included her choice of three items which were spinach, bacon, and mushrooms served with potatoes  The hosts are efficient at seating the tables and the servers handle the volume quite well, but are sure to have occasional absences because of the number of tables they are covering. We've never had an issue with the kitchen as they handle the number of orders well also.   Prices probably average between the $9 and $10 range which I think is fair considering the portion sizes. If you're in the area, and see that there is no line, I would stop by because they  consistently provide a good experience.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach, bacon, and mushroom omelette
Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crunchberry French toast

Fe8671GncmjOdkQxwyJSog.text: Nice breakfast. Our server was great!! He kept my drink topped off and checked on us with a witty sense of humor.  I always appreciate a place that offers turkey bacon, as I don't eat pork. The turkey bacon was cooked perfect and my eggs we cooked as I asked. Plenty of food for a good price.

EX8YrdAOWShyVYMxceAwhA.text: Update 10/24/17:  Visited here today for breakfast and I decided to try something new.  I voted for the Potato Chip Nachos but I wished I hadn't.  Everything on top was really good, but the chips themselves were Ruffles (exact brand unknown), but you know what kind of chips they are right?  I thought they would be some house-made chips capable of carrying the toppings, but I only found 3 viable chips, all the rest were sogged out and had to be forked.  Big disappointment, but my bagel was great and so was my coffee.  No change in stars as it's the only thing I haven't thoroughly enjoyed in my 3 visits.  Original Post:  Our local friends highly recommended this place and it did not disappoint.  Slight wait at 11:30 on a Saturday which was surprisingly shorter than we expected.  Great patio area where many had their dogs with them.  We were seated at the counter which we never prefer but we're starving and so we took it (they did ask us when we put our name in if the counter was ok).  It was a bit noisy at the counter but not terrible. I mention this only if you are going to have a catch-up conversation with an old friend vs just catching a bite.  The entire staff seemed to be having a blast at work and were great.  My hubby got the philly and was in love from the first bite.  I had the corned beef hash and it was very good and huge.  Definitely will make another visit before going home.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The corned beef hash w/ everything bagel &amp; cream cheese (the pickles were from my hubby&#39;s sammich)

B-aIy0xddAQRh6n23Yp8Sw.text: Our family loves this restaurant and we eat here all the time. Breakfast wraps and salsa are delicious and just the right size. The coffee is always hot and tastes great and the staff is very friendly and attentive to the tables as well. We mostly hit this place for breakfast but have eaten here for lunch a few times as well and the lunch menu is great. Lunch wraps and salads are well put together and taste great! You can't really go wrong with any of the large breakfast choices. The muffins and bagels are really great too if you're looking for a lighter breakfast.

vBhWBOn--ue2XQLRixJobA.text: Best diner in town! I've lived in many small towns with excellent home-spun breakfasts and lunches. Not the same in this town...too many places think un seasoned eggs and bland potatoes passes for brunch, not at sunrise! There's plenty to choose from and it's all successfully accomplished. The benedicts are the only reason this isn't 5-star: they are flavorful and well done, but the Kaiser roll is an odd choice and not one comes with a real piece of ham. Eat here, eat anything, eat a lot, just get I early so you beat the rush!

hhd4mydoyeZCz5K7-1KToQ.text: The crunchberry french toast was unbelievable! Outdoor seating, incredibly fast and friendly service, my new fav breakfast place for sure!

ea7q7LXWgTXZpe75fEbMcg.text: This used to be one of our go to breakfast spots.  We took a break for awhile because we always seem to have some sort of issue.  Our first visit back and it was more of the same.  I ordered plain bagel in my eggs benedict and got an everything bagel, hubby didn't get the correct items in his create your own omelette. Nothing that would ruin a meal but a little annoying.  Hubby used to love the Crunchberry French Toast.  On this visit it did not live up to what he remembered.  You couldn't taste any Crunchberry flavor.  It tasted like regular french toast with a berry sauce.  There are a few pluses, you can get half orders of french toast and service is always friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1/2 order The Ultimate French Toast
Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Create your own omelette
Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1/2 order Crunchberry French Toast

ss7-tsuGUFLnenqhWra18g.text: The best breakfast restuarant in Henderson, very quick friendly service There garden of eidon plate is so yummy we enjoyed all my family was happy I highly recommend this place

aYTUiSwaEt2no7L6UZ6_Zw.text: Always good, fast, and friendly service.   Clean.  Great food.    Caring staff and ownership.  Diverse menu.

duYVuN5P0enghyBSIsmCQQ.text: The food is really good but I have a couple of issues. Charging someone 4$ for a piece of Canadian Bacon is absolutely criminal!! Last and most importantly the Server we had was insanely rude. We usually have the guy with the Braves hat and he is always super friendly and really good. Today we had a lady who was in a total rush, talked over me while I was attempting to order, and was pushy with the check. She came over to take the final copy of the check and saw the tip I left and decided to give me a dirty look. Classless and unprofessional. I love coming here, but I'm never coming in the afternoon again. I left feeling insulted honestly.

c1nNp7vkfj4wZAVRVqYLvQ.text: Great place with a great atmosphere. Staff was wonderful. Shout out to Brandon who waited on us. Thank you.

egvNhE2AWXzO54yVXgboBA.text: WOW.   I don't even know where to start with this review!   First & foremost, everybody who works here is so kind and sweet. They all matched each other's level of friendliness. They're service was fast, efficient, and very welcoming. Troy was our server, he was very attentive without being too suffocating. He made great suggestions. They have a great menu.   It was our first time here. YELP BROUGHT US HERE :)   We ordered the Turkey Links & Eggs as well as the Crunchberry French Toast. The Turkey links were perfectly cooked. They weren't greasy or overcooked & dried out. The flavor was great. The potatoes had a nice, crisp finish to them. And the Crunchberry French Toast.... OH. MY. GOD. Seriously to die for. They serve it with a blueberry cream cheese frosting & powdered sugar. They also brought around a blueberry jam/syrup. It's made in house, btw! The flavors just really blended perfectly.   We will be back very soon!  Definitely recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crunchberry French Toast.... YES.

qK3iEFWZfe2VhMuv7my1wg.text: This is at the top of my list for weekend brunch spots. I noticed this spot a couple of months ago when I had dinner at Lucky Foo's. I promptly forgot about it and then saw it again a few days ago and decided that I needed to give it a try.   My husband I arrived at the prime breakfast time. Prime breakfast time is apparently 10:30 a.m. for those that are wondering. We got on the waiting list and were told it'd be about 25 minutes. It ended up taking this long, but was worth the wait.   I had the Cajun Prime Rib Beni. This was a delicious combination of Texas Toast, prime rib, onions, mushrooms, and hollandaise sauce. Yum. The meat was delicious and sliced thin which was the perfect consistency for a dish like this. There was also Cajun seasoning on top that really added to the dish without overwhelming it. I also loved the hashbrowns served on the side and found that ketchup was unnecessary.   My husband had the Steak & Egg Wrap. It was tasty, but definitely not the most exciting thing on the menu. My husband loved it.   The service was friendly and efficient. Our waitress took good care of us and didn't leave us wondering where she was at any point. Her other table was a group of 20 and she still gave us great service.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak &amp; Egg Wrap
Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cajun Prime Rib Beni

RcN5IEm9NJIh_0gtZtrjLQ.text: My family and I love to stop by for Sunday breakfast. Food is fresh, hot, and delicious. Staff is very hospitable. Location is clean and inviting. We have become repeat customers.

CwVj64HCZET6ZeWyVF3lxQ.text: Still great.  Visited on Saturday with some friends who used to be LV locals and Sunrise regulars.  Breakfast was delicious.   I like the new interior too. Is cheerful and perfectly bold/neutral at the same time.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zA2d9zU8Yk-NuAJgn6ZRuQ.text: Although our server, Tyler, was lovely, we felt abandoned towards the end, which's when we needed more of his service. Someone else gave me second glass of hot water. My bf asked for a water and took so long that we just left.   Wait was reasonable.   Ultimate French toast was yummy! It did not taste like egg. Idk if you guys tasted a French toast that's eggy? Not this one. But beware, it is very sweet.   Potato hash was burnt (see picture).   There was a girl server who was complaining to Tyler (we were seated at the bar/counter) even if she knows that customers can overhear her...unprofessional. Kudos to Tyler for pacifying her.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ultimate French Toast

blb3fwFr6_1umZZ2H0e3Ng.text: This place has never let me down. Usually busy with a standard wait time to be seated but very worth being patient. Decent portions of food. Great staff! They get your order correct and pay attention to your dietary needs if you are restricted on certain allergy related foods.   We've tried many of the dishes on menu and have favorites. Once you find you're go to dish it's hard to break out and sample new fare!   The only wish I have for them is that they'd be able to offer a truly non-dairy creamer such as an oat or coconut based version.

HjUHyzAGUyYCJjITRbigHQ.text: I never go wrong every time I come here. Food is tasty and have healthy options. The menu is big ( I s Rialto think it's too big ) but enough selections for breakfast and lunch . The service is outstanding and awesome. Price is fair . Tip? Weekends don't come here when you're very hungry and expect to get seated right away because there could be a wait. Not a bad wait tho'. So I recommend this place and will be back here. :)

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vjSB_CmqLeRMEdRrcASabA.text: Looking for a good spot to have breakfast and decided on Sunrise cafe based on reviews.  Once inside you must wait to be seated which only took 5 minutes for a party of four.  I decided to have there classic breakfast which had two eggs, hash brown, rye bread with Canadian bacon.  I shared an order of there banana pie pancakes because they looked irresistible and the hunger was real that morning lol!  My friend decided on a healthier meal and ordered the famous oatmeal with a nice amount of blueberries and bananas.  The breakfast came out quick and everything was on point. They one thing I thought was missing was a nice cappuccino they only serve American coffee.  Prices are great and service was awesome!  Great spot overall would recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Famous oatmeal
Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Classic breakfast
Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana pie pancakes

Qg7K_c4g7QW7ybOvttbycg.text: This place is HANDS-DOWN the BEST breakfast place I've ever been to.   To start, it seemed a little sketchy walking into a secluded complex on the side of a busy street. Nonetheless, I'm glad not a lot of people know about this place. It is a hidden gem.   Walking in, I was greeted by the most warm, welcoming faces. Everyone was wearing a "Be Kind" shirt, which if you didn't know, is a Las Vegas originated organization by the Josh Stevens Foundation to be more kind. It was amazing to see everyone in this attire and to ultimately show that actions speak louder than words. It's one thing for a company to say they support an organization, but it's a completely different ballpark when a company truly takes initiative to showcase their beliefs.  I was unable to get my servers name, but she was amazing. Super attentive and super friendly.   I was told they're known for their Banana Bread Pudding French Toast, but something about the Prime Rib Beni tickled my funny bone, because most places can't cook the prime rib right. Either too rubbery or too underdone.  Getting the Prime Rib Beni was one of the best decisions I've ever made in my life, not even exaggerating. It brought me to a childhood that only memories can explain. The best bagel I've ever had in a Benedict. (Pro tip: get it with the poached egg rather than scrambled. I believe it made it 100% better.)   This place is unmatched. Thanks for the great breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cajun Prime Rib Beni

EkCnCj89RZ2vThF48QGotg.text: I keep coming back for more, but have yet to find something I love. I have tried a Benny, a wrap, and a breakfast plate. The wait is never long, the food comes fast, and the service is great but it never hits the spot I'm looking to fill.   The other half ordered a steak and omelet and didn't really enjoy it either.   I love supporting my local community, but there's just so many other spots that fulfill that breakfast craving. It is close to home but I'm starting to wonder if I will be going back anytime soon.

kxqeJmgEC07BAfHBJavhhQ.text: Umm, yes please. Serendipity. Must experience this yummy place if driving through for a flavorful treat.  Mike was amazing, thanks for great service and recommendations!

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flavored coffee of the day with Sunrise Snow Caps....dipped and savor! Definitely a must!!!!

kNmf_23QFKBL0bmhS3CQmw.text: Ryan (boyfriend) and I came here to enjoy brunch together it's been way over do to try this place. I was meeting my boyfriend there so he was already seat when I got there. When I arrived there was no one at the host stand so I made was way over to the dinning room floor to find Ryan. The place is small and cozy. Right as I sit down he tells me the waiter spilled water on him, I'm sure it was an accident. Moving on I noticed I had no menu so I grabbed one from the bartender and sat back down. Ryan ordered two eggs sunny side up, with Canadian bacon, sourdough toast, 3dollar size pancakes, and black coffee. He said the coffee wasn't the best but it was drinkable lol.  I ordered the Californian omelette egg whites, tomatoes, mushrooms, spinach, and avocado. I replaced my toast for a banana, the server was kind enough to offer the replacement. The food was delicious !!!!!!!!! Besides the rough start the overall experience was wonderful!

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Californian
Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

QVowNFQthfnZxqCXAxew1Q.text: Outstanding!  But don't waste your visit on something traditional like eggs Benedict!   Jump into one of their specialties that they are known for!   They have an incredible selection of French toasts and other kinds of pancakes.   They seem to manage a crowd perfectly too.  We were there late Saturday morning and no wait but people kept flowing in and out.  Also know:   If you're not a big eater, you can order half portions on some meals.  We didn't learn this until it was too late but next time we'll order half portions.   Will definitely be back!

7l4b08m8swKkUaMnfVqakg.text: Really great service even though it was so packed and busy! I ordered Californian omelette and omg it was so good! I was only able to eat half of it there and ate the rest the next day and it was still good. Honestly would come back just for that the next time we go to Vegas! I like how the waitress got a bucket for the kids to pick out toys or candy.

qeyK_CwPlXZUgrOfBSxrdg.text: I really enjoyed my visit here! All the employees were very nice and the place is right next to my gym so I did feel a little guilty eating the crunchberry French toast on my rest day . I came here with my 9yr old and my 8month old daughters on a Thursday around noon. We were sat down relatively quickly and didn't have to wait long to place our order. I had the crunch berry French toast and a side of potatoes and my daughter had the kids scramble with bacon. For me and my daughters meal the price was under $30 so I would say it was very affordable. We will for sure be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crunchberry French toast

2sqENVB5q5RRAd9TNVqWww.text: Was looking for a place before heading out of las vegas and I truly hit the jackpot. I had this bagel with onions, capers, cream cheese, and salmon. This was amazing!!!! Place is awfully friendly and pretty quick to serve. Will definitely be here any time I visit this town.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bagel and lox platter

KalNaOD9BEldbEfxhqFTBg.text: Well...I have to be the bad guy again.  I can say with 100% certainty that my experience here was superior to the Kitchen Table restaurant(Horizon Ridge PKWY) in every single way.  They were prompt, the servers were attentive, and there wasn't anything baffling that stood out that wasn't simply personal preference.  However, that simply raises it's level slightly.  I ordered the cinnamon swirl french toast, which was tiny and I made it a platter with bacon and eggs.  This place is not like Black Bear or Baby Stacks where the combinations are possible at a price that is fair.  I think I overpaid for what I ordered by a large margin...which brings me to why I rated it 3 stars.  It wasn't great, it wasn't bad, it didn't anger me, but it left me feeling empty.  I would call that ironic if I weren't still hungry after spending $15 for bacon, eggs, and French Toast.  I should have went with the platter, but hindsight is completely useless.  If I return, I'll get the platter, but I don't see myself doing so.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon Swirl French Toast.  It was ok.
Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon and Eggs.  If only I had just ordered these and saved myself 8 bucks.

EVXxdNuBaxVAvimpfSFaoQ.text: Been here a couple of times now and the food and service is always great.  Our last visit we were taken care of by Matt.   Always checked in with us to make sure everything was good.  He even split our order for us when he knew we were splitting our food without us asking.  He was always just a step ahead of what was needed. Matt was the best!  Thank you. We will be back soon (maybe even today. Lol)!

ZwnOv1F3NVTWjnDXibJGGg.text: Service and food are excellent!! We plan on coming back each time we visit Vegas. Jesse our server was awesome, attentive, and friendly.

2kHx99XTvpJgdW35LkItOw.text: Great service. Great food.  Visiting from Hawai'I and always looking for new brunch spots.  This place hit the spot. Really nice host and server, attentive but not annoying.  Food was tasty with big portions at a great price. The three of us shared the Sunrise Snow Caps (so addicting), my sons ordered the Cajun Prime Rib Benny (so tasty) and the Bread Pudding Pancakes (brilliant concept) and I ordered the Crunchberry Fresh Toast (delicious). What a nice brunch experience. Can't wait to eat here again during our next visit to Sin City.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crunchberry French Toast....sooooo good!!
Photo of The Original Sunrise Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunrise Snow Caps ...... ADDICTING!!!!

I ordered the eggs Benedict on a bagel it was yummy. We waited less than 5 minutes to be seated. Service was excellent. Will defiantly go back again. Mahalo Sunrise Cafe!!
